		Question: what did f. scott fitzgerald do
		Answer:
answer: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer, widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century. He is best known for his novels The Great Gatsby (1925), Tender Is the Night (1934), and The Beautiful and Damned (1922). Fitzgerald also wrote numerous short stories, many of which were published in The Saturday Evening Post.
